div.p: 1. The most general word for the native ability to understand or to do things is zhī 知 "knowing", but a problem with this word is that it ranges freely and often imperceptibly in meaning from spiritual wisdom to technical competence.
2. Míng 明 (ant. àn 闇 "obfuscated in one's mind"), taking its analogy from sharpness of vision, typically refers to clarity of insight at all levels.
3. Cōng 聰 (ant. kuì 聵 "hard of understanding"), taking its analogy from sharpness of hearing, typically refers to well-informed sharpness of judgment.
4. Shān 顫 is a very rare word referring to the acute sense of smell, and thus to narine intelligence.
5. Chá 察 refers to discriminating investigative intelligence.
SHU, HONGFAN: 視曰明，聽曰聰，思曰睿。
rough draft to BEGIN TO identify synonym group members for analysis, based on CL etc. 18.11.2003. CH ／

bibl.title: Novyj objasnitel'nyj Slovar' Sinonimov Russkogo Jazyka
A Dictionary of Selected Synonyms in the Principal Indo-European Languages
Vocabulaire européen des philosophies. Dictionnaire des intraduisibles

note.p: prudens refers to someone who has the accurate practical views and skills.
scitus refers to someone who has tact, mother-wit, and common sense.
solers refers to someone who posesses practical genius and inventive power.
cordatus refers to someone who has commendable basic moral orientations.

bibl.title: SYNONYMES FRANÇOIS, LEURS DIFFÉRENTES SIGNIFICATIONS, ET LE CHOIX QU'IL EN FAUT FAIRE Pour parler avec justesse
SYNONYMES FRANÇOIS, LEURS DIFFÉRENTES SIGNIFICATIONS, ET LE CHOIX QU'IL EN FAUT FAIRE Pour parler avec justesse

entry.def: Chá 察 refers to discriminating investigative intelligence.

sense.def: be astute, intellectually sharp, clever; sharp-sighted, incisive (also with nonhuman subjects)

bibl.title: 漢語重言詞詞典 Hanyu chongwenci cidian

sense.def: reduplicated: be intelligent, bright, clearheaded, wise (Tang, more frequent from Song times onwards)

entry.def: Míng 明 (ant. àn 闇 "obfuscated in one's mind"), taking its analogy from sharpness of vision, typically refers to clarity of insight at all levels.

sense.def: e.g. 知道者謂之明，行道者謂之賢 be good at seeing things, be visually talented> be intelligent; be perspicacious, be enlightened
cause to be good at seeing things> sharpen the sight of

entry.def: The most general word for native ability to understand is zhī 知 (ant. wú zhī 無知 "lack the ability to understand"), but the word ranges in meaning from spiritual wisdom to technical competence.
The most general word for native ability to understand is zhī 知 (ant. wú zhī 無知 "lack the ability to understand"), but the word ranges in meaning from spiritual wisdom to technical competence.

sense.def: read zhì: intellect; intellectual competence, professional competence; intelligence, intellectual capacity
become more clever, become more intelligent
the intelligent (pervasively difficult to distinguish from the wise)
one's intelligence; one's understanding; one's cognitive capacities
in one's intelligence, with regard to one's intelligence
belonging to an intellectualy competent person

entry.def: Cōng 聰 (ant. kuì 聵 "hard of understanding"), taking its analogy from sharpness of hearing, typically refers to well-informed sharpness of judgment.

sense.def: acoustic intelligence> ability to understand a truth when one hears it
one who is intelligent> the intelligent
be sharp of hearing; by extension: be sharp of understanding; be all-informed
be sharp of understanding; be well-informed
intelligent perception or awareness of things
faculty of discrimination and understanding things

entry.def: Shān 顫 is a very rare word referring to the acute sense of smell, and thus to narine intelligence.

sense.def: ZHUANG, LIE acute sense of smell
be endowed with superior comprehensive intellectual facultaties and talent
supernatural intelligence; supernatural or cosmic virtues; spiritual enlightenment
eloquent and intelligent, well-spoken and intelligent
a learned man by the name of Npr
with a sharp mind > intelligent, bright, of quick comprehension
colloquial: have much knowledge+suffix > be smart, be intelligent, be a smart-ass
be [served] with perspicacity; be well understood in respect to service
in every way perceptive; intelligent; astutely clever Shiji: 皇帝聰明，張守節注：聞見明辯。
superior intelligence; intellectual powers; intellect; discriminating understanding of what is heard/learnt and seen Shiji: 皇帝聰明，張守節注：聞見明辯。
evokes the idea of perfect perspicacity
be of quick mind and a shrewd understanding of things
